block.title: Overview
block.text: I was getting into 3D printing, and had just bought myself a Ender 3 Pro. This was really fun to make! I 3D printed the whole thing, and recently launched it. Stay tuned for part two, including a parachute.

block.title: Videos
block.text: Here are some videos of the rocket in action!

block.title: Materials
block.text: This was designed and 3D printed, so the whole of the rocket is made of PLA plastic. I printed part of it at school (shoutout to Mr. Cox for letting me use the school printer) and the rest at home in three different parts, and attatched them all. One thing to note is that this first design does not include a parachute, so it did just fall from the sky :). I used a makeshift launchstand, which was two 2x4s attatched with one screw, and used some hockey tape to attatch a 'launch rod' that I got from Home Depot.

block.title: Engines
block.text: The engines were C6-3 engines that I got from the Canadian Rocket Store. This was actually very interesting, as since I designed the rocket to be 3 seperate parts, after the delay it blew up. For those who aren't aware, the rocket engines have a delay on them, these engines 3 seconds, and after the delay it shoots gas into the top of the rocket, pressurizing it and causing the top to pop off. This is meant for parachute deploy on time, but this ended up just exploding the rocket into a few peices. I kind of expected it, but it was funny to see it blast apart in a puff of smoke.
